Articles.Content: I think it's astronauts/ cosmonauts. 18D "Revin", 19A "Leonov", etc.

Any idea for 11 accross? That's Canada space agency btw.

- - - Updated - - -

Wait, maybe 11 across is RADARSAT.
11 horizontal: Radarsat

You guys should have spellchecked it before showing it, lol XD

I wonder if they're including the Soviet era with Roscosmos.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T15:00:40Z" title="04/20/2015 03:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by smjjames**

> 
> 11 horizontal: Radarsat

And i thought it was Hadfield... :-(
Canadian Chris 'Hadfield' fits for 11-across.
yeah, I am trying to avoid Roscosmos and Nasa atm, they have a ton of missions each, could be a lot of things. Concentrating on the smaller space agencies, far fewer options...
5 across is most likely Hiten, which makes 2 down Vega probably.
If 7 down is Aldrin, 7 across could be Armstrong.. 9 down Ride... 10 across Lu... 8 down Shepherd (not Shepard)... ok if it's all astronaut names this should be straightforward.
Anyone else print it out?

**12 down** seems to be **Gagarin**. I'm filling it out in MS Paint. If I get any more, I'll let you guys know ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Scratch that, misread the damn thing ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

EDIT: Hang on, there's a problem with 12. ESA is listed as 12 down, and ROSCOSMOS is listed as 12 across, but the problem is 12 across doesn't exist on this board. Which agency are we supposed to use here? ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T15:12:43Z" title="04/20/2015 03:12  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by RogueMason**

> 
> Anyone else print it out?

yes, but this is far more cryptic than any crosswords I have seen before. Lots of clues are the same! I think its good though, because its meant to be solved as a collective effort of many brains working together, with a help of a planetary information network. What a world we live in... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> If 7 down is Aldrin, 7 across could be Armstrong.. 9 down Ride... 10 across Lu... 8 down Shepherd (not Shepard)... ok if it's all astronaut names this should be straightforward.

Following that line of argument, 3 down could also be Cristoforetti. (Current ISS crew member).

> 
> **12 down** seems to be **Gagarin**. I'm filling it out in MS Paint. If I get any more, I'll let you guys know ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> Scratch that, misread the damn thing ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
> 
> EDIT: Hang on, there's a problem with 12. ESA is listed as 12 down, and ROSCOSMOS is listed as 12 across, but the problem is 12 across doesn't exist on this board. Which agency are we supposed to use here? ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

12 Down Guidoni

1d Tereshkova! 3a Carpenter!

I wonder if they made a mistake and 12d should in fact be a Russian, Gagarin... there does not seem to be an ESA astronaut that fits.

All mistakes on the puzzle forgiven, it means they're spending their QA time on the game.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T15:18:56Z" title="04/20/2015 03:18  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**

> 
> EDIT: Hang on, there's a problem with 12. ESA is listed as 12 down, and ROSCOSMOS is listed as 12 across, but the problem is 12 across doesn't exist on this board. Which agency are we supposed to use here? ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

I presume 12 down is ESA, and the nonexistent 12 across was supposed to be 16 across?

> 
> I presume 12 down is ESA, and the nonexistent 12 across was supposed to be 16 across?

That's basically what happened... there's an updated puzzle: [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDC072SVAAA4oOt.png:large](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDC072SVAAA4oOt.png:large)

> 
> **12 down** seems to be **Gagarin**. I'm filling it out in MS Paint. If I get any more, I'll let you guys know ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> Scratch that, misread the damn thing ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
> 
> EDIT: Hang on, there's a problem with 12. ESA is listed as 12 down, and ROSCOSMOS is listed as 12 across, but the problem is 12 across doesn't exist on this board. Which agency are we supposed to use here? ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

Logically 12 across on that list refers to 16 across, as 16 across does not have an entry.
Right, just using the updated one now, but yeah, I should have noticed that 16 across ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
I feel like we may see flags for all these missions in game. Not sure what other thing they could be advertising with the clues in the countdown, other than some very Klever ideas.

If 3 across is Curiosity, 1 down could be FobosGrunt. Hard to say though. Problem with this crossword is that there seem to be multiple valid solutions and no real way of determining which is the "official" answer.

It looks like the agencies are who gave the ride rather than the astronaut who took it.

 For example, if an American astronaut rides a Soyuz, they would appear under "ROSCOSMOS" rather than "NASA".

> 
> That's basically what happened... there's an updated puzzle: [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDC072SVAAA4oOt.png:large](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDC072SVAAA4oOt.png:large)

Thanks for the update-- that makes 8d Shepard, not the more obscure Shepherd
